org.dcm4che3.conf.api

Interface DicomConfiguration

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DicomConfigurationManager, ExtendedDicomConfiguration
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommonDicomConfiguration, CommonDicomConfigurationWithHL7

    public interface DicomConfiguration
    This interface should be used by vendors/integrators to access and manipulate the DICOM configuration in a type-safe way. Always give the preference to this interface when possible.
    Author:
    Gunter Zeilinger , Roman K

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  DicomConfiguration.DicomConfigBatch
      Defines a configuration batch that allows to execute configuration changes in a bulk-type manner.

      • merge

        void merge(Device device)
    throws ConfigurationException
        Replaces the full configuration of a device in the configuration backend with the configuration of the provided device. The behavior is similar to JPA's merge.
        Parameters:
        device - Device to merge
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - When an error occured during the operation

      • sync

        void sync()
   throws ConfigurationException
        Invalidates any present cached state for the configuration storage view of the client. There is no guarantee whether the devices accessed afterwards will be re-loaded lazily or eagerly. Has no effect for non-cached or consistently-cached configuration storage backends.
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - - in case an extension of specified class is nto found

      • runBatch

        void runBatch(DicomConfiguration.DicomConfigBatch dicomConfigBatch)
        Provides support for batching configuration changes.

        It is guaranteed that
        • All configuration reads and writes in a batch are performed within a single transaction, i.e. the changes are atomic and performed in READ COMMITTED isolation
        • When this method is called, an ongoing transaction (in case there is one) will be SUSPENDED. The batch will ALWAYS be executed in a SEPARATE transaction.
        • At most ONE batch is executed at the same time in the whole cluster (synchronized with a database lock)
        Parameters:
        dicomConfigBatch - Configuration batch to execute
